title: PRD ReDesign: OTC Product Page

background.description: The OTC Product Page is one of the most critical points in the OTC funnel. It's where users decide whether to purchase, based on the product's purpose, price, brand, trust, and delivery promises.
user_arrival_paths: Internal navigation: via the Homepage or subcategory pages
External traffic: from marketing campaigns (mainly Google Merchant)
background.challenge: Users coming directly from Google Merchant often don't know DoktorABC, they lack context and trust. The page must therefore communicate who we are, why we're reliable, and why it's worth purchasing through us.

main_user_problems: Limited product variety (only ~2,000 SKUs) compared to competitors with tens of thousands
Users arriving directly from ads don't understand who DoktorABC is or why they can trust us
Lack of visible product and service reviews makes users hesitant to complete a purchase
success_indicators: +20% increase in conversion from product page → paid order
+10% increase in AOV via the 'Usually bought together' product carousels

requirements: Search bar with hamburger menu icon
Displays full path: Home → Category → Subcategory → Product
Product image carousel (swipe right/left on mobile)
design_sections.notes: Focus on clarity and quick purchase
Visual icons with color, same style as homepage

requirements: Display user's product + up to 2 complementary products (max 3 total)
Show combined regular price and bundled price
Include all relevant details: usage, ingredients, manufacturer, dosage, etc.
Carousel of related products (same structure as Homepage product cards)
Include discount tags, stock label, add-to-cart button
4 questions about DoktorABC (trust, shipping, returns, security)

development_requirements.description: The page includes the OTC Navbar component (same as on all OTC pages). It contains: Company logo, Search bar (OTC products only), E-prescription button (navigates to DoktorABC homepage), Cart icon, My Account, and Hamburger menu. The navbar is sticky during scroll.
Display the OTC CRM coupon strip (same as shown on the OTC homepage). On mobile, it appears above the navbar. Content is pulled from CRM and controlled by the marketing team.
Display the full breadcrumb navigation path as in production: Home → Category → Sub-category → Product. It must update dynamically based on the user's location and selected product.

The product section displays: Product images (if discount, show discount badge % off on image), Stock label ('In Stock' or 'Out of Stock'), Share button (clicking opens share popup), Product name, Product price (if discounted, show new price in red with strike-through line on old price), Package selector (dropdown that loads all available product packages from DB), Quantity selector (dropdown that loads available quantities from DB), Add to cart button (clicking adds selected package and quantity to cart and opens the cart), Free shipping info (if product qualifies for free shipping, show text: 'Free shipping from 30 EUR' or respective localized value). All data (price, availability, discount, quantity, packages) must come dynamically from DB.

Display the standard 4 OTC USPs: Delivered in 1-2 working days, 24/7 customer service, Free shipping over €30 (value pulled from DB), Our own brand product. If the free shipping value = 0, hide that USP and center the other three.

The purpose of this section is to increase average order value by suggesting additional OTC products that are commonly purchased together with the current product. Display 3 products by default: Product 1 = always the main product (the one the user is viewing). Product 2 and 3 = the two OTC products most frequently purchased together with this product in the last 30 days. If there is no data for 30 days, extend to 3 months → then 12 months. If no data found, display 2 random in-stock products from the same category. Product card in this section includes: image, product name, price, discount badge (if applicable), and old price in red with strike-through. Default state: all 3 products are selected (checked). Users can deselect and reselect products freely. The text above ('3 products selected') and the CTA button text change dynamically based on the number of products selected. When the user clicks the CTA button, all selected products are added to the cart.

Display a carousel of OTC product cards (same design as other pages). The products are pulled randomly from all OTC categories and displayed with the same card layout: product image, name, brand, price, discount badge (if any), stock label, and add-to-cart button.

Display the product description (HTML) pulled from DB. The description includes all relevant details: product usage, ingredients, manufacturer, dosage, and other specifications. The layout must support formatted text (paragraphs, bullet lists, links).

Display the standard OTC FAQ section (accordion format) with default OTC questions and answers pulled from DB. The first question is open by default. All content must be localized according to the page language (DE/FR).
Display the DoktorABC footer component, identical to the one on other OTC pages. It must include localized content, links, and compliance information according to the user's country.
